description: Creates a custom action that can be invoked as an alias or as a button on a notification.

parameters.name: Definition
parameters.description: The definition of the command to run when invoked as an alias or as an action button. The command string to run which may include variables by prefixing with a dollar sign ($).

nested_params.name: CommandText
nested_params.description: The command string to run which may include variables by prefixing with a dollar sign ($).

parameters.name: Attachments
parameters.description: Defines when this custom action button should be attached to a notification. (dict) --- Defines when a custom action button should be attached to a notification. NotificationType (string) --- The type of notification that the custom action should be attached to. ButtonText (string) --- The text of the button that appears on the notification. Criteria (list) --- The criteria for when a button should be shown based on values in the notification. (dict) --- A criteria for when a button should be shown based on values in the notification The operation to perform on the named variable. The name of the variable to operate on. Value (string) --- A value that is compared with the actual value of the variable based on the behavior of the operator. Variables (dict) --- The variables to extract from the notification. (string) --- (string) ---

nested_params.name: NotificationType
nested_params.description: The type of notification that the custom action should be attached to.

nested_params.name: ButtonText
nested_params.description: The text of the button that appears on the notification.

nested_params.name: Criteria
nested_params.description: The criteria for when a button should be shown based on values in the notification.

nested_params.name: Operator
nested_params.description: The operation to perform on the named variable.

nested_params.name: VariableName
nested_params.description: The name of the variable to operate on.

nested_params.name: Value
nested_params.description: A value that is compared with the actual value of the variable based on the behavior of the operator.

nested_params.name: Variables
nested_params.description: The variables to extract from the notification.

parameters.name: Tags
parameters.description: A map of tags assigned to a resource. A tag is a string-to-string map of key-value pairs. (dict) --- A key-value pair. A tag consists of a tag key and a tag value. Tag keys and tag values are both required, but tag values can be empty (null) strings. For more information, see User-Defined Tag Restrictions in the AWS Billing and Cost Management User Guide. The key of the tag. The value of the tag.

parameters.name: ClientToken
parameters.description: A unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request. Idempotency ensures that an API request completes only once. With an idempotent request, if the original request completes successfully, subsequent retries with the same client token returns the result from the original successful request. If you do not specify a client token, one is automatically generated by the SDK. This field is autopopulated if not provided.

parameters.name: ActionName
parameters.description: The name of the custom action. This name is included in the Amazon Resource Name (ARN).

nested_items.name: CustomActionArn
nested_items.description: The fully defined ARN of the custom action.
